H0.text: To do the investigation at the same time of year is the most important procedure to follow for another student to obtain the same results when investigating the effect of red, yellow, and green light on plant growth.

H1.text: Using the same chart for recording growth is the most important procedure for another student to follow in order to yield the same results when investigating the effect of the color of light—red, yellow, and green—on plant growth.

H2.text: Doing the investigation in the same room is the most important procedure to follow for another student to yield the same results when studying the effect of red, yellow, and green light on plant growth.

H3.text: To use the same colors of lights is the most important procedure to follow to yield the same results in an experiment investigating the effect of the color of light on plant growth, which used red, yellow, and green lights.

A4.text: The rate of carbon assimilation varies with irradiance, increasing as the irradiance increases, but reaching a plateau at higher irradiance.

A5.text: Plants' photosynthetic action spectrum has absorption peaks in violet-blue and red light.
